result.execSummary:
The defendant Brandon Lee Sanderson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Brandon Lee Sanderson is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Brandon Lee Sanderson was found guilty of Possess Amphetamine/LSD/Psilocin, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(d).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
- Sign up for Probation on by the end of business day on 07/26/22. 
- Concurrent without prejudice to consecutive sentencing in the event of Probation Revocation 

In the event that the defendant is revoked or discharged from either probation or extended supervision with outstanding financial obligations, the supervising agent shall notify the court 10 days prior to the revocation or discharge.  A civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victim(s) and/or governmental entities for any balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect all debt.
Concurrent with: 21CF933 Count 2.

e: DOC
Filed by Atty Larimore. arc
Filed by ADA Smestad. km

1:00 PM Apprs: CO: S. Needham, Rpr: V. Kasten, Clerk: B Harris, Defendant Brandon L Sanderson in court.  Prosecuting attorney Brian Thomas Smestad in court for the State of Wisconsin.   Attorney Joel Kenneth Larimore in court for Brandon L Sanderson. Includes 21CF933 & 22CF25.  ADA Smestad states the matters are resolved but does not have an amended information for Count 1 in 22CF25 ready for today, if Court is willing to accept an oral amendment to do pleas today an Amended Information will be filed immediately.  Atty Larimore is in agreement and prefers to finish this today.  Court grants the State time to file an amended information that will mirror the complaint. Court reads charge and maximum penalty. DE pleads  G to Ct 2- Theft Movable Property & AMENDED Ct 1- Possession of Amphetamines 961.(3g)(d) in 22CF25. DE sworn. Crt reviews plea questionnaire and informs DE of rights. Crt finds DE freely, voluntarily and knowingly waives rights and makes plea. Attorney's stipulate to the facts. Crt accepts plea, finds factual basis and finds DE guilty of Ct 2 in 21CF933 & AMENDED Ct 1 in 22CF25. On motion of the State without objection, Crt dismisses Ct 1 in 21CF933 & Ct 2 in 22CF25. Sentencing arguments.

Court Orders: Ct 2 in 21CF933

S/W 18 Months Probation- Concurrent on each count, Probation is concurrent without prejudice to consecutive sentencing in the event of Probation revocation. 

- Court Costs: $243.00 
- DNA Sample and Surcharge: $200.00
Balance to be pd through probation

Conditions of Probation: 

- Absolute Sobriety, exempt from prescribed medications
- Let agent know of treatment programs, sign all appropriate release forms
- No Contact with Walmart in New Richmond, WI 

- Sign up for probation by end of business day. 

Court Orders: AMENDED Ct 1 in 22CF25

S/W 18 Months Probation- Concurrent on each count, Probation is concurrent without prejudice to consecutive sentencing in the event of Probation revocation. 

- Court Costs: $243.00  
- DNA Sample and Surcharge: $200.00
Apply bond, balance to be paid through probation

Conditions of probation to mirror Count 2 in 21CF933. 

4 days credit against ultimate sentence.

Includes 21CF933 and 22CF25.

  _X_ SIGNATURE BOND:   _X_ Defendant
guarantees compliance with the terms of this bond by pledging $1000
and understands that if the defendant does not comply with the terms of this bond, the bond will be forfeited and the defendant and/or surety may be ordered to pay the amount of the bond.

Absolute sobriety:  Zero alcohol, zero controlled substances, zero prescribed medications (except as taken and prescribed for you by a physician) in your system, on your person, or in your possession at all times while this case is ongoing. This prohibition includes drug paraphernalia. Testing upon reasonable suspicion or at the Court's directive. All costs associated with testing shall be the responsibility of the defendant.

I understand that I must report to and comply with all terms, conditions, and protocols of the St. Croix County Justice Support Center. I further understand that I am required to submit to random drug testing at least ONE time per week. Failure to report and/or comply with conditions and/or protocols may result in a report to the District Attorney's Office, an arrest warrant, and/or referral for criminal charges.

I understand that I must report to the Justice Support Center immediately. If after regular business hours I must call (715)245-4109 to schedule an appointment with the Justice Support Center by the end of the following business day.

It is hereby ordered, as a condition of the defendant's bond/bail in the above-captioned case, that he/she have absolutely NO CONTACT whatsoever with the complaining witness, or with any of the following named persons and/or locations, Walmart.  The term "no contact" is hereby defined as no contact in person, by telephone, by way of electronic device, email, facsimile, social media including but not limited to texting, Facebook, Twitter, contact through the mail, and/or through a third person.  The aforementioned condition of bond/bail is set pursuant to Sec. 969.02(3)(d), Wis Stats.

If the defendant fails to comply with the conditions of his/her bond/bail that he/she may be charged with the offense of bail jumping.
